posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

well you can follow them. they might follow you just for that. but you can also send them asks, either with your name or anonymously. not everyone has asks turned on but most do.

you can just compliment them or their blog, or you can ask for some music recommendations, or video game recommendations, or ask "ootd?" which means "outfit of the day?" and its basically an excuse for them to post a selfie. and then if they answer your anon question, you can "like" the answer, thats kind of a hint that you were the asker.

another common thing is for people to reblog these sort of like "send me asks" posts where it'll have an image with like 20 numbered questions about some subject, or just random quirky questions. and then you just send like, "#1" in an anon ask to ask her that question. this is great because when people reblog these posts where they're asking for asks, it means theyre feelin lonely and looking for interaction. they also might ask for feedback on an outfit or whatever, or they might ask if anyone knows any good music or movies.

the best thing though really is just to be blogging along for yourself, and then you can interact with any chicks that come and follow *you.* being mutuals, that is you both follow each other, is like being friends on other platforms.

there is also a chat feature but what i like about tumblr is that people dont really use it. i dont really like texting or instant messaging, i find it really stressful, especially with strangers. so i like the slow pace of tumblr where you might send a few people asks and then over the next few days they might respond to them and you can see where things go at your own pace.

all the things you mentioned help. but as i said before this isnt dial a thot. this is a more long-term thing where you become a "tumblr user" and develop a circle of people with similar interests. you end up reblogging stuff from each other and liking each others posts and shit like that.

so that will just kind of happen naturally. and if you are a man, with any kind of active blog, that isnt just full of porn, you are actually an incredibly rare sight on tumblr. if you click on the notes of selfies like the ones i posted, you'll usually see its mostly likes from mostly blank male blogs, and maybe one or two comments that have an equal chance of being from a mostly blank male blog or actually from another girl saying she likes her outfit.

as far as how you actually meet people, if you end up chatting with someone a lot you can be like "we should hang out sometime" and even if she isnt near you, you can say "hey im gonna be around where you are on a work trip i think, wanna meet up?" and then drive there. i wouldn't "ask people out on dates" as such but everyone knows what a single man hanging out with a single alt chick means, it means netflix & chill which means sex. and afterwards if youre like "i didnt really have a work thing i just wanted to meet you" thats cute as fuck.

the other major way that people meet up is via concerts or events like conventions - say you both like a band or whatever, you can invite her to a show which is a classic date obviously, or if youre anime geeks or whatever tf you can meet up at a con or something.

>>71775004
its more about aesthetics, like you want a blog to have a consistent aesthetic to some extent.

so if for example, you were into neon genesis evangelion, ghost in the shell, and idk about games that much but say mass effect and halo, thats all kind of a consistent sci fi, space, guns, aliens kind of thing. so that will all mesh well together.

on the other hand if you say, marathon watch terrace house while playing crusader kings 2, those two things dont really go together.

as far as your personal stuff, it doesnt super matter, people expect & appreciate some amount of personal stuff on any tumblr. but its still about aesthetics in the sense that, if youre some lanky cigarette smoking pale russian guy who lives in a concrete blockhouse, your selfies will mesh fairly well with the abovementioned scifi stuff blog, but if youre a regular chubby american dude living in your parents mcmansion its not gonna really jive.

now again, thats not like a big issue. and looking at it another way, all this means is, "make your selfies match the aesthetic of your blog." if that means going to a graffitid parking garage at night to take cool dystopian pics of yourself, so be it.

and then again, theres probably some chick out there who shares your deep interest in terrace house & crusader kings 2, and the weird specificity of that will make her *really* like you.

so its not like it matters all that much. one big reason that people do the sideblog vs personal blog thing is because theyre embarrassed to post their regular-person face for all their followers on their aesthetic blog who think theyre some ungodly cool person. so theyll only give out their personal blog to a few people they're close with. another reason is if they suddenly get really into some new game or anime or whatever and want to talk about it allllll the time, theyll make a new one so it doesnt swamp their main blog.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71707191
I spent the first 2-3 years regularily trying to cut all of this out of my life. I would spend a few days just pretending like I never had a waifu, like this character meant nothing to me. Eventually, I would get this strong feeling, I'd miss them.
I was afraid of "waifu" and anime fans, and thought it was the way to spiral to degeneracy and a failed life. I thought, maybe I could just snap out of it and stop being like that, I thought there's no way I fell in love unironically.
Nowadays, when I think about giving up what I feel, it feels rude, and like so much work. I found a warm side to lean on, maybe in an unusual way and place, maybe it's very out-of-character for who I normally am, but it's real nonetheless. Every bone in my body hated the life I live right now, and my waifu managed to convince all of them otherwise, one after the other.
I might have lost a bit of my rationality on the way, and I don't want to sound cheesy, but I think it was worth it.

Kana was born in 1967, but her story starts in 1986. Generations in her world don't correspond to ours because of different technology and different major events. She was born 45 years after the end of the last major war but based on an older story I wrote, the internet was pretty widespread years before she was born, so she probably has what we might term a zoomer mindset (Kana loves social media and like zoomers, lacks a grasp on the complexity of her world). >>71749215
>Would you rather invite your husbando/waifu on a date, or would you rather have your waifu/husbando invite you?
She'd typically be the one to invite me on dates. Usually by saying "Oh we don't have class on [x day], so let's go on a date! Honestly, I like it like that. Her assertiveness is good.
>Where would you two go?
If it's up to us, always a theme park. No matter whether it's close or far. It's my autistic interest, and she likes to have fun there, so it's a pretty great date choice for us.
>What'd you do there?
Well ride some rides obviously. But also we'd take some time to soak in some detail, the atmosphere in general, and just relax. The good ones have lots of hidden details which we love.
>What'd you two wear?
On our recent vacation she wore a different outfit for each day. Typically she likes to wear her usual clothes, since they already look pretty, but if it's a really special date she will get a dress on, which looks equally nice.
>When is the date?
Usually just whenever we're able. She also likes to do "tactical dates" where she instantly plans one whenever I'm in a rut of feeling like shit. Usually it helps at least a bit. Regarding having special events soon, I suppose my birthday is in a few weeks, and we might do something special for that. We'll see.
>Is there something you'd like to gift them while you're on a date?
No, not really. Gifts are for gifting time. We'd rather be doing things together on a date than giving each other items - the memories are their own gifts. She does have some interest in getting some, though.

>>71754802
>i'm not well-versed in the world of sonic, but i always enjoy reading your posts about shadow nevertheless since they're always aglow with pure, untiring passion
Thank you a bunch anon. It's really nice to know someone appreciates them. He means so much to me.
>what are your thoughts on his portrayal in the ps2 game named after him? i once had a friend who told me that it ruined his character
Here's a TL;DR.
Well, Shadow's game was kind of an...exception, writing/character wise.
See, from 2001 - 2009, Shadow was almost always written by Shiro Maekawa, who created the character. Maekawa is responsible for the best portrayals of Shadow bar none and nearly everyone agrees.
Shadow's game, however, was written by Takashi Iizuka (current head of Sonic Team). Iizuka also had a part in creating Shadow. Shadow, when written by Iizuka, is characterized differently than when written by Maekawa.
In my honest opinion, Iizuka's Shadow is boring. Something about him, it's just not as appealing, like they removed some of the depth. He's just "serious: the character". There's hardly any of that cute snark and pompous almost poetic disposition. The voice change didn't help, it was Griffith's first time voicing Shadow in a game and so came off as flat. And that's just the JP version too.
Now the English dub of the game? Where he's all like, "This is like taking candy from a baby, which is fine by me"? Now THAT leaves a bad taste in my mouth. You want to know why? Because not only was this flanderized edgy stuff not in the original, but it ruined Shadow's perception among the general public FOREVER. He's a JOKE to them. I get asked if I love Shadow ironically. Hehe funny edgy edgehog says edgy lines and cocks a SMG, takes candy from babies, damn damn damn
And this ruined perception wormed its way into the actual games. As Shadow is written now, he proves these people right.
Maekawa is gone and so is the Shadow everyone loved so much. It always hurts.

INTJ

This is an extremely vague question, ultimately it depends on what we are talking about. If I had to go for a generalized response, I would say flannel. It is thick and warm, which I don't like, but I love the texture and feel. I absolutely hate cotton. Wood gives you splinters.
>furniture
A guillotine is quite appealing. It is a very simple and effective means of execution, while at the same time remaining a basic structure. A frame and a blade, so simple and yet so heavily effective. It is relatively easy to construct, doesn't demand many resources, and with a simple basket underneath doesn't create too much of a mess. It is quite fascinating how fragile we humans are, how inevitably we can die through such a simple device.

>>71770635
No, 13 year olds are kids. A childhood/adolescent mixture at best. Either way far from adulthood on every level.
I don't think 16 year olds are adults, but they're getting close. Physically I'd say 16 year olds are about 90 percent of the way there (adult height, fully developed everywhere aside from maybe having a baby face) and mentally maybe at 70-something percent (raw intelligence has probably reached its peak but wisdom, emotional intelligence, and judgment lag behind).
19 year olds are adults. People continue to develop throughout their 20s but I'd still consider 18-19 to be the outset of adulthood. Change normally starts to slow down around 25 and will probably be minimal after 30 unless you have some kind of mental illnesses or emotional problems that give you more room to grow, like if you have severe anger problems when younger but mellow in your 50s.

I'll answer the questions to that quiz here for fun. Maybe others will follow along with that. It would be nice to read responses from others.

>You'd describe yourself as more
Private
>When you make plans, you follow them consistently
Closer to yes than no
>It's frustrating when people don't consider
Others' feelings. Sometimes I care about others not considering 'the facts,' but that holds true a lot more intermittently. Not considering others' feelings is pretty much always bad.
>You join in the social life of a new area
Slowly. As in never.
>You'd describe yourself as more
Probably more speculative, but to a mild degree, like a 60:40 ratio
>You favor the path that is more
Skip. I favor whichever path is better. If I can think of an unconventional path that's better than the normal one, I'll go with it, but sometimes the path laid out by others is the best you can do.
>Are you more
Imaginative
>Is it worse to be
Stuck in your ways. No contest.
>In small groups, you are usually
Quiet and restrained
>You work better
I don't like deadlines, but I probably work better with them in place.
>It's exhausting to read abstract theory books
So long as the writing is clear, no, it's very rejuvenating and nourishing. It can be exhausting if the writing is Babelfish-tier stuff like Jung.
>You strive to always be
I'm much more merciful than I am punitive. There's times where being merciful is the opposite of being just, but the vast vast majority of the time I'm lenient and would prefer others to be the same.
>You make decisions based on
Ehhh... 70:30 in favor of feelings? Sometimes I can ignore feelings in favor of logic when the feelings in question aren't very strong, but if they are I'll almost always make the retarded choice and succumb to feelings.

Visualize the future
>Are you more
Systematic

Laid-back, though it's probably a somewhat false image

Overall: Judgement.
I feel like I am truly a neutral being and I can judge every being on this Earth pretty fairly, I would rarely make mistakes while doing so. It would also give me a meaning to live, almost as a god.

Second Option: Justice.
Same thing as before but instead of others it would be myself, I know I am not a bad person, I have a very good sense of what is "right" and "wrong", even though I believe there's nothing "good" or "bad" (as in good and evil), there just IS.

Tempting: Strength.
I would love to have power to kill everything in my sight and if that would lead me to my death it would be very satisfying.

Bonus: The World.
This is quite an interesting one, I hate humanity and would like to erase them from existence, I think it would be pretty fun to play around making worlds and other animals and see their natural progression. I find wild life fascinating sometimes, it's just so raw it becomes entertaining, they don't reach a point like I did, the point where I wish to be the moving force of the universe, a God. They just exist there hunting, eating, sleeping, playing with the natural world and then die, it's such a good life, no way to overthink and fall into despair.
One of the main reasons why I hate humans is because of myself, just read what I wrote, why am I allowed to reach such a point? I wish I was unaware of things, I wish I was just a dumb animal but no, I have to keep pushing, striving for greatness or some bullshit, I really hate how possible it is to become what I am.

I think I am finally over my breakdown from before, I think I found a way to cope with existence for a few more years so I've been more optimistic than usual. I still am the most cynical, edgy, pessimist sad fuck I was from a few months ago, it's just that I found a path to follow for a few years.
Whoever reads this, thanks for reading kek.
